titlestmt.titleproper: Woodhaven, NY. First Congregational Church memorial resolution, November 6, 1932.
titlestmt.author: William McCarthy

conventiondeclaration.citation: Describing Archives: A Content Standard, Second Edition

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday July 25, 2019 at 19:09

did.unittitle: Woodhaven, NY. First Congregational Church memorial resolution, November 6, 1932.
did.abstract: The First Congregational Church of Woodhaven was opened in 1863 and continued to operate until 1973. No information could be found on Mr. or Mrs. Schaeffler. This collection contains a memorial resoulution presented to Mr. William B. Schaeffler on the occasion of the dedication of the electric cross given to this church by him in memory of his beloved wife Mrs. William B. Schaeffler [Bertie].

persname.part: First Congregational Church of Woodhaven (Woodhaven, New York, N.Y.)

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Woodhaven, NY. First Congregational Church memorial resolution, November 6, 1932, RG5399. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated to the Congregational Library & Archives by Laura Natoli in April 2019; 2019-11.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by William McCarthy, July 2019, using DACS second edition.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: The First Congregational Church of Woodhaven was opened in 1863 and continued to operate until 1973. No information could be found on William or Bertie Schaeffler.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a memorial resoulution presented to Mr. William B. Schaeffler on the occasion of the dedication of the electric cross given to this church by him in memory of his beloved wife Mrs. William B. Schaeffler [Bertie].

persname.part: First Congregational Church of Woodhaven (Woodhaven, New York, N.Y.)
